page.title: 05 VIETNAM TO BACKWORTH--BINH.
page.content: I was born in Vietnam.When the war was nearly over I was one and a half.My brother was born in a cave uring the war in Vietnam.The cave where my family hid was wet.They had to climb steps to a well to get water. The steps were slippy like marble and dangerous. When we left we were lucky we got onto a ferry which did not sink. We landed in Hong Kong.We lived in a village of tents.It was not very nice.We were not allowed to stay in Hong Kong and were flown to Newcastle.I lived in a Y.M.C.A in Stockton until we were given a house in Backworth. My parents have been to college to learn English but only know a little. They do not have jobs.My father was a blacksmith in Vietnam.We left everthing in Vietnam except our valuables and some clothes.
